resources.string: Buda Castle is the historical castle and palace complex of the Hungarian kings in Budapest, and was first completed in 1265.
The Fisherman\'s Bastion is a terrace in neo-Gothic and neo-Romanesque style situated on the Buda bank of the Danube, on the Castle hill in Budapest, around Matthias Church.
The Chain Bridge is a suspension bridge that spans the River Danube between Buda and Pest, the western and eastern sides of Budapest, the capital of Hungary.

Heroes Square is one of the major squares in Budapest, Hungary, noted for its iconic statue complex featuring the Seven Chieftains of the Magyars and other important national leaders, as well as the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier.
Take a walk to the most highest place in the Pilis Mountains is the 757 m high "Pilis Peak" and enjoy the superb view from Boldog Özséb (Blessed Eusebius) Lookout.

The look-out tower is barely visible from the roads nearby, its wood structure is well hidden in the forest. It is only accessible from hiking trails, but it appears to the hikers when they are really close.

The Elizabeth Lookout is a historic lookout tower on János-hegy above Budapest. Built in 1911, the tower was named after Empress Elisabeth, wife of Emperor Franz Joseph I. Frigyes Schulek was the architect.
On top of the Nagy-Hárs Hill in the Buda Hills is this lookout where the panorama is really stunning.
This is such a professional restaurant and bar,the staff are very knowledgeable about the beer\'s they serve and take pride in what they offer their customers.
On the menu a wide variety of Hungarian and international dishes, including a selection of fish, poultry and meat dishes; on the wine list a reasonable selection of Hungarian wines and other drinks.
The Costes Downtown was awarded with Michelin Star in 2016 March, shortly after opening. In the restaurant we offer to the gastronomy lovers breakfast, lunch and dinner every day.
A streamline and comforting place focusing on gastronomy in the 7th district, in the middle of the historically jewish quarter, today\'s downtown\'s night-life center.

Budapest Zoo and Botanical Garden is the oldest zoo park in Hungary and one of the oldest in the world. It has 1,072 animal species and is located within Városliget Park, unusually for a zoo, it is in the centre of the city.

MINIVERSUM is a gigantic, beautifully detailed and decorated model layout featuring many sights and landmarks from Budapest and Hungary – and a bit of Austria and Germany – scaled to 1:100 of original size.
Zoo Cafe is not just an ordinary cafe, it’s more than many free, stunning and exotic animals to present, pet or get to know them.

The Center of Scientific Wonders is not simply an exhibition, but a 1700 square-meter physics play-house, where over 1700 square-meter physics play-house children learn about the phenomena of physics in a fun way.
